summary: "Romeo and Juliet" is a famous tragedy by William Shakespeare about two young lovers from fighting families in Italy. It's one of his most popular plays and is often performed. The story is based on an old Italian tale, but Shakespeare made it more complex with interesting characters like Mercutio. Written around 1591-1595, it was first published in 1597. Shakespeare's clever use of poetry and structure makes the play exciting. Over time, it's been turned into movies, musicals, and operas, with different versions changing the story a bit.
title: Romeo and Juliet
